intro: Ceratostema angulatum, commonly known as the angular ceratostema, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Sarcandraceae and is characterized by its unique, angular leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Its ornamental value lies in its striking foliage and delicate blooms, making it a sought-after plant in horticultural collections. Ceratostema angulatum is also noted for its ability to thrive in dry conditions, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
